definition.name: accessibility-scanner
definition.description: Finds potential accessibility gaps, files GitHub issues to track them, and attempts to fix them with Copilot.
definition.author: github

inputs.name: urls
inputs.description: Newline-delimited list of URLs to check for accessibility issues

inputs.name: repository
inputs.description: Repository (with owner) to file issues in

inputs.name: token
inputs.description: Personal access token (PAT) with fine-grained permissions 'contents: write', 'issues: write', and 'pull_requests: write'

inputs.name: cache_key
inputs.description: Key for caching results across runs

inputs.name: login_url
inputs.description: If scanned pages require authentication, the URL of the login page

inputs.name: username
inputs.description: If scanned pages require authentication, the username to use for login

inputs.name: password
inputs.description: If scanned pages require authentication, the password to use for login

inputs.name: auth_context
inputs.description: If scanned pages require authentication, a stringified JSON object containing 'username', 'password', 'cookies', and/or 'localStorage' from an authenticated session

inputs.name: skip_copilot_assignment
inputs.description: Whether to skip assigning filed issues to Copilot

outputs.name: results
outputs.description: List of issues and pull requests filed (and their associated finding(s)), as stringified JSON
